title: Design and Operation of a Single-Mode Language Tutoring System for Students with Learning Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic educational technology and methods for supporting students with learning disabilities, experience in teaching grammar and vocabulary in language education
context.additional_context: Exploring the design and operation of intelligent tutoring systems for pre-service/in-service teachers to support students with learning disabilities in language education. Developing personalized language teaching methodologies through individual text analysis, writing feedback, and reading proficiency assessment.

learning_goals: Develop the ability to design intelligent tutoring system interfaces for integrated reading-writing support while monitoring emotional states and cognitive load of students with learning disabilities.
Acquire skills to develop language learning content using single-mode instructional methods and measure the effectiveness of reading-comprehension and expression enhancement.
Cultivate the ability to analyze learner language responses using SVM classification techniques and derive personalized vocabulary/grammar feedback.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
